deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: What programming languages and tools were used for the MedInsight: Flu Tracking Tool project?
deep_resume_analyst.pdf.answer: PostgreSQL, Tableau, Synthea, and Python are not all used in MedInsight, but rather PostgreSQL, Tableau, and Synthea.

deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: The MedInsight project analyzed less than 1 million patient records.
The Restaurant Launch Optimization project used _______ for sentiment analysis, topic modeling, and dynamic visualizations.
What was the outcome of the Restaurant Launch Optimization project?
options: C) No change in projected revenue

deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: How many Yelp reviews were analyzed for competitor analysis in the Restaurant Launch Optimization project?
The MedInsight project used Python as a primary programming language.
The MedInsight project tracked _______ distribution to aid data-driven vaccination strategies.
What tools were used for the MedInsight: Flu Tracking Tool project?
options: A) Python, Pandas, MS Excel, NLP

deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: What machine learning models were used to boost accuracy by 8% and improve system reliability?
The Claims NPS process A/B tests resulted in a reduction of client churn by 10 accounts in 2 months.
The ETL pipeline for automating Claims dashboards was built using _______ , _______ , _______ , and _______ .
What was the outcome of implementing K-Means Clustering for investor targeting?
options: C) Reduction of investor targeting time by 30%
D) Improvement of data accuracy by 10%

deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: How much time was saved per week by automating funding performance tracking?
The development of data consolidation workflows for M&A projects reduced the turnaround time from 5 days to 1 day.
The Aggregated Data Sheet was constructed by analyzing _______ data points using MySQL and Excel.
What was the result of using SQL and Python for data cleaning and organizing 50+ files?
deep_resume_analyst.pdf.answer: B) Boosted data processing efficiency by 30% and accuracy by 25%
options: A) Boosted data processing efficiency by 10% and accuracy by 15%
B) Boosted data processing efficiency by 30% and accuracy by 25%
C) Boosted data processing efficiency by 20% and accuracy by 30%
D) Boosted data processing efficiency by 40% and accuracy by 20%

deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: What is Deep Suchak's current degree pursuit and the institution he is attending?
deep_resume_analyst.pdf.answer: Masters in Data Science at Worcester Polytechnic Institute

deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: Deep Suchak has a GPA of 4.0 in his Masters in Data Science.
Deep Suchak's technical proficiency includes programming languages such as _______________________, Pytorch, and Pandas.
What was the outcome of the K-Prototypes based customer segmentation system developed by Deep Suchak?
deep_resume_analyst.pdf.answer: C) It achieved a silhouette score of 0.85 and boosted targeted product engagement by 15%
options: A) It decreased targeted product engagement by 10%
B) It achieved a silhouette score of 0.6 and boosted targeted product engagement by 5%
C) It achieved a silhouette score of 0.85 and boosted targeted product engagement by 15%
D) It had no impact on targeted product engagement

deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: What was the result of using Power BI dashboards designed by Deep Suchak to analyze customer segments?
Deep Suchak re-engineered the existing Insurance Premium Rate predictor from Python to MS Excel.
Deep Suchak's experience includes working as a Data Analyst Intern at _______________________, where he developed a K-Prototypes based customer segmentation system.
What was the size of the high-dimensional datasets engineered by Deep Suchak using Python?
What was the outcome of Deep Suchak's work in reducing claim payout discrepancies and improving premium accuracy?
deep_resume_analyst.pdf.answer: It improved premium accuracy for 10K+ policyholders

deep_resume_analyst.pdf.content: Deep Suchak has experience working with database management systems such as MySQL and PostgreSQL.
Deep Suchak's skills include _______________________, which involves Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and Descriptive Statistics.
What was the improvement in financial predictability achieved by Deep Suchak's work in designing Power BI dashboards?

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the primary way to gain experience solving interesting problems in the course?
The midterm and final exams are cumulative.
The case studies are to be done in teams of _______.
How many sheets of paper can you bring to the exams?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: C) Up to four 8 ½ by 11 sheets of paper
options: C) Up to four 8 ½ by 11 sheets of paper

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the basis for grading the case studies?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: The quality and completeness of presentations and the submitted reports.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: The instructor reserves the right to curve the final grades.
The instructor reserves the right to make changes to the syllabus, assignments, etc. with _______ notice.
What can result in up to 5% bonus points?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: C) Any of the following: attendance and class participation, improvements to case studies, suggestions for additional course topics, and other items at the discretion of the instructor
options: A) Only attendance and class participation
B) Improvements to case studies and suggestions for additional course topics
C) Any of the following: attendance and class participation, improvements to case studies, suggestions for additional course topics, and other items at the discretion of the instructor

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: When can bonus points no longer be given?
Collaboration is allowed during the exams.
The exams will be _______ note.
What is the collaboration policy for the case studies?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) Teams of 1-3, see the syllabus for details
options: B) Teams of 1-3, see the syllabus for details

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the most important part of the learning experience in the class?
True or False: The instructor believes that there are dumb questions in class.
To get the most out of the class, students should _______________________ to class and ask questions during discussions.
What will the instructor post on canvas.wpi.edu after each class?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: C) Annotated PDFs of slides, videos, etc.
options: C) Annotated PDFs of slides, videos, etc.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: Why should students ask questions in class?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: Because any question asked will help classmates as much as the student asking.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: True or False: The instructor will not provide any resources or materials on canvas.wpi.edu.
The instructor suggests that students get accounts on _______________________.
What is the purpose of the case studies in the class?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: C) To get students' hands dirty and provide a hands-on learning experience
options: C) To get students' hands dirty and provide a hands-on learning experience

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the instructor's approach to questions in class?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: The instructor believes there are no dumb questions and encourages students to ask questions.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: True or False: The class will not cover any practical or hands-on experiences.
The instructor recommends that students visit _______________________ for free resources.
What is the benefit of asking questions in class, according to the instructor?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: C) It will help the student asking the question and their classmates
options: A) It will only help the student asking the question
B) It will help the instructor understand the material better
C) It will help the student asking the question and their classmates
D) It will distract the class

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the main focus of the DS/CS553 course?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: The main focus of the DS/CS553 course is Machine Learning Development and Operations (MLOps).

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: The DS/CS553 course is held on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
The course DS/CS553 will cover the development, debugging, deployment, and subsequent _______________________ phases of models in end-to-end pipelines core to machine learning systems.
What is the name of the professor teaching the DS/CS553 course?
What is the course number for the Machine Learning Development and Operations (MLOps) course?
The course DS/CS553 teaches students the computational skills required in the fields of Art and Music.
The course DS/CS553 will cover programming languages commonly used in AI and Data Science, such as _______________________.
What is the time of the DS/CS553 course on Mondays and Wednesdays?
What is the location of Prof. Randy Paffenroth's office?
The course DS/CS553 is a 2-credit course.
The student will engage in hands-on projects to practice their programming skills to solve real-world _______________________ and Data Science problems.
What is the day and time of Prof. Randy Paffenroth's office hours?
What is the penalty for taking a late exam?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: 30% penalty, with a maximum possible grade of 70%

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: True or False: More than one case study can be submitted up to one week late for full credit.
If a student needs to take an exam early due to a conflict, they should notify the instructor at least _______ weeks before the exam date.
What is the latest time a case study can be submitted to receive any credit?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) Before the last class of the semester
options: A) At the beginning of the last class of the semester
B) Before the last class of the semester
C) During the last class of the semester
D) After the last class of the semester

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What should students do if they have a foreseeable conflict with a case-study due date or exam due to a religious holiday?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: Contact the instructor within the first two weeks of the first class meeting to discuss and make fair and reasonable adjustments to the schedule and/or tasks.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: True or False: The instructor will not make any effort to accommodate students with personal emergencies.
In the event of a medical or family emergency, students should contact _______ to find appropriate accommodation.
What is the penalty for submitting a case study more than one week late?
Where can students find the course syllabus and other relevant information?
True or False: The instructor is committed to providing equivalent educational opportunities to students of all belief systems.
Students can submit one case study up to _______ week late for full credit.
What is the maximum possible grade for a late exam?
What should students do if they have any doubts about what is allowed or not allowed in the course?
The classroom is only inclusive to individuals of specific backgrounds and beliefs.
Students with approved academic accommodations should submit their accommodation letters through the _______________________.
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: Office of Accessibility Services Student Portal

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: How can students who are not currently registered with the Office of Accessibility Services find out more information about requesting accommodations?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) By contacting the Office of Accessibility Services via email, phone, or in-person
options: A) By contacting Prof. Paffenroth directly
B) By contacting the Office of Accessibility Services via email, phone, or in-person
C) By submitting a request through the course website
D) By attending a meeting with the Morgan Teaching Center

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What kind of environment is expected to be maintained by all members of the class?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: A respectful, welcoming, and inclusive environment

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: Students are required to inform Prof. Paffenroth about their pronoun(s) and/or preferred name at the beginning of the course.
Students who would like to request accommodations should contact the Office of Accessibility Services at _______________________ or by phone at _______________________.
What is the location of the Office of Accessibility Services?
What should students do if they have questions about how accommodations can be implemented in the course?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: Contact Prof. Paffenroth as soon as possible

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: The course has a make-up exam policy.
The classroom is a place where students will be treated with _______________________.
What is the best way for students to ensure they are addressed properly by Prof. Paffenroth?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) By telling Prof. Paffenroth their pronoun(s) and/or preferred name at any time
options: A) By introducing themselves on the first day of class
B) By telling Prof. Paffenroth their pronoun(s) and/or preferred name at any time
C) By submitting a request through the course website
D) By contacting the Office of Accessibility Services

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the primary expectation for students regarding WPI's Academic Honesty policies?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: Each student is expected to familiarize him/herself with WPI’s Academic Honesty policies.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: Collaboration is allowed on exams.
Collaboration is encouraged on _______________________, and students can select their own teams of 1-3 for these assignments.
What is considered a violation of the collaboration policy?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) Two different case study teams sharing a solution to any assigned problem.
options: A) Students within a team sharing solutions and code for a problem.
B) Two different case study teams sharing a solution to any assigned problem.
C) Discussing an assignment at the level of goals with students from different teams.
D) Working individually on all assignments.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: Where can students find further information on WPI's Academic Honesty policies?
Sharing code or plots between case study teams is allowed.
Any acts of _______________________, plagiarism, cheating, and facilitation will be prosecuted according to the university’s policy.
What should students do if they are unsure about whether their intended actions are considered academically honest?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) Contact their instructor in advance.
options: A) Ignore the policy and proceed with their actions.
B) Contact their instructor in advance.
C) Discuss the issue with their peers.
D) Report themselves for academic dishonesty.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the consequence for violating the collaboration policy?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: All violations of the collaboration policy will be handled in accordance with the WPI Academic Honesty Policy.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: Students from different teams can discuss an assignment at the level of goals.
Each team is responsible for generating ________________________ and writing up results on their own from scratch for case studies.
What is an example of an action that would not be a violation of the collaboration policy?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: C) Students from different teams discussing an assignment at the level of goals.
options: A) Sharing a solution to an assigned problem between two different case study teams.
B) Allowing another case study team to copy any part of a solution to an assigned problem.
C) Students from different teams discussing an assignment at the level of goals.
D) Sharing code or plots between case study teams.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the primary focus of the course in terms of hands-on activities?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: The primary focus is on hands-on projects and case studies, including developing models using shell scripts, Python, and other system tools in a Linux environment.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: The course is intended to be a programming course where code will be graded.
The course will utilize ____________________ as the primary programming language.
What is the recommended way to approach learning Python for the course?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) Use a combination of textbooks and online resources
options: A) Rely solely on YouTube videos
B) Use a combination of textbooks and online resources
C) Focus only on Python for Data Analysis by Wes McKinney
D) Ignore external resources and only use course materials

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: Where can students find electronic versions of the recommended background books for the class?
The midterm and final exams will be cumulative and closed note.
Students are allowed to bring in up to ____________________ 8 ½ by 11 sheets of paper for each exam.
What is the primary criterion for grading exams in the course?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) Demonstrated understanding of key concepts
options: B) Demonstrated understanding of key concepts
C) Quantity of notes brought to the exam

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: How will the base lecture notes be made available to students?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: The base lecture notes will be posted on the class web page before or after class, along with any annotations made during class.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: The course has a single textbook that will be covered in detail.
The course will include ____________________ and in-class discussions as important activities.
What resource is available for students to learn Python, aside from textbooks?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: C) Numerous YouTube videos, but with caution
options: C) Numerous YouTube videos, but with caution

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is DevOps?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: DevOps is a paradigm that aims to deploy and maintain software reliably and efficiently, combining development and operations.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: MLOps is easier to implement than DevOps for deterministic software.
MLOps involves deploying and maintaining _______ models in production reliably and efficiently.
What is a key aspect of MLOps beyond just ML model codes?
What is the primary goal of MLOps?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: To deploy and maintain machine learning models in production reliably and efficiently.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: MLOps is a compound of "machine learning" and the continuous delivery practice of DevOps.
MLOps is practiced between _______ to transition the algorithm to production systems.
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: Data Scientists, DevOps, and Machine Learning engineers

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is required to take a class on MLOps?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: B) Prior knowledge of machine learning and deep learning
options: B) Prior knowledge of machine learning and deep learning

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the relationship between MLOps and DevOps?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: MLOps is DevOps for ML-infused software, applying the same principles to machine learning models.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: The class on MLOps will remain the same next year as it is this year.
MLOps involves considering _______ such as hyperparameters and training configs.
What is a key challenge in implementing MLOps?
options: A) Integrating with existing software systems

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: What is the best way to contact the instructor during business hours?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: WPI email: rcpaffenroth@wpi.edu or Zoom room: https://wpi.zoom.us/my/rcpaffenroth

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: The instructor is available to answer email questions 24/7.
The instructor has a Ph.D. in _______________________ from the University of Maryland.
What is the instructor's focus of study in their Ph.D.?
What is the instructor's current area of work at WPI?
The instructor worked at the California Institute of Technology.
The instructor rewrote a software package from _______________________ to C.
What is the name of the cluster that the instructor is a heavy user of?
What are the office hours of Simeon Krastev?
MLOps is a type of DevOps applied to Machine Learning.
MLOps is a type of _______________________ applied to Machine Learning.
What is the location of Yang Wu's office hours?
What is the main focus of the course?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: The main focus of the course is on the development, debugging, deployment, and subsequent monitoring phases of machine learning models in end-to-end pipelines.

notesClass1 after class.pdf.content: The course covers only technical aspects of machine learning.
The course will cover key topics including a primer on _______________________, the "Data pipeline, and the Machine Learning Lifecycle.
What programming language will be used in the course?
What are some examples of packages and systems that can be leveraged in the class?
notesClass1 after class.pdf.answer: PyTorch, Cloud providers such as Azure, AWS, or GCP, HuggingFace, Prometheus, Github, Docker, etc.

docker.pdf.content: What is the purpose of using "old" tools in the first half of the class?
docker.pdf.answer: To lay a foundation on which more advanced tools can be built.

docker.pdf.content: Docker containers are a type of Virtual Machine (VM).
The command to list all running Docker containers is _______.
What is the primary reason for using melnibone as an SSH "gateway" service?
docker.pdf.answer: B) To utilize WPI IT's security expertise
options: A) To demonstrate complex networking concepts
B) To utilize WPI IT's security expertise
C) To provide a simple connection to the VM
D) To allow for easy scalability

docker.pdf.content: What is the difference between a Docker container and a Virtual Machine (VM)?
docker.pdf.answer: Docker containers and VM have fundamentally different architectures and benefits.

docker.pdf.content: The port number used for SSH connections is unique for each group.
The command to change the directory to /home is _______.
What is the purpose of using a "gateway" machine name like melnibone?
docker.pdf.answer: B) To add an extra layer of security
options: A) To provide a direct connection to the real hardware
B) To add an extra layer of security
C) To allow for easy scalability
D) To demonstrate complex networking concepts

docker.pdf.content: What is the benefit of using Docker containers over VMs?
docker.pdf.answer: Docker containers provide easy connection to make and have fundamentally different benefits compared to VMs.

docker.pdf.content: The real hardware is directly accessible through the SSH connection.
The command to list the files in the current directory is _______.
What is the relationship between Docker containers and LXD VM?
docker.pdf.answer: A) Docker containers run inside LXD VM
options: A) Docker containers run inside LXD VM
B) LXD VM runs inside Docker containers
C) Docker containers and LXD VM are unrelated
D) LXD VM is a type of Docker container

docker.pdf.content: What is the course name and number for Machine Learning Development and Operations?
docker.pdf.answer: DS/CS553 – Machine Learning Development and Operations (MLOps)

docker.pdf.content: The midterm is being graded immediately after submission.
The new server for CS3 has _______ CPUs.
What is the consequence of submitting a Case Study late after the first one?
Why did the professor not bother the TAs last week?
docker.pdf.answer: The professor wanted the TAs to have a break.

docker.pdf.content: The new server for CS3 is dedicated to each group.
The new server for CS3 has _______ GB of memory.
What is the plan for the product while the CEO is away?
docker.pdf.answer: B) Transition the product to Docker
options: A) Transition to a new CEO
B) Transition the product to Docker
C) Keep the product as is

docker.pdf.content: What is the significance of using Docker?
The old VMs are still available for use.
The new server for CS3 has _______ TB of disk space.
What is the professor's role in the narrative?
docker.pdf.answer: A) A humble professor and narrator
options: A) A humble professor and narrator

docker.pdf.content: What is the primary benefit of using Docker containers over virtual machines (VMs)?
docker.pdf.answer: Increased performance, with a 27% to 46% improvement after tuning.

docker.pdf.content: Docker containers and virtual machines are mutually exclusive.
Docker allowed for savings in ______________________ and disk as well.
What is the purpose of a Dockerfile?
options: C) To create a new Docker image
D) To push Docker images to Docker Hub

docker.pdf.content: What is the command to build a Docker image from a Dockerfile in the current directory, and tag it as "rpaff/cs553_example"?
Docker containers can only run on virtual machines.
To run a Docker container in detached mode, you use the ______________________ option.
What is the benefit of using Docker Desktop?
docker.pdf.answer: C) It is the #1 containerization tool for developers
options: A) It is the #2 containerization tool for developers
B) It is only used for running Docker containers on virtual machines
C) It is the #1 containerization tool for developers
D) It is used for creating new Docker images

docker.pdf.content: What is the command to run a Docker container and execute a bash shell inside it?
Docker Hub is a container image library that requires an account to use.
To update the package list in a Docker container running Ubuntu, you use the command ______________________.
What is the purpose of the "docker push" command?
docker.pdf.answer: C) To push a Docker image to Docker Hub
options: A) To run a Docker container
B) To build a Docker image
C) To push a Docker image to Docker Hub
D) To create a new Dockerfile
